name: Eric C. COLEMAN and Linda Coleman, Husband and Wife, Timothy G. Carroll, Individually and as Executor of the Estate of Louise Carroll, Deceased, Respondents v. Duane MORRIS, LLP and Kathleen M. Shay, Esquire, Petitioners

parties: Eric C. COLEMAN and Linda Coleman, Husband and Wife, Timothy G. Carroll, Individually and as Executor of the Estate of Louise Carroll, Deceased, Respondents v. Duane MORRIS, LLP and Kathleen M. Shay, Esquire, Petitioners.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 13th day of June 2013, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The issue, as stated by petitioner, is:
Does the limitation on damages in a legal malpractice action sounding only in contract set forth in Bailey v. Tucker, 533 Pa. 237, 252, 621 A.2d 108, 115 (1993) — which limited such damages to “the amount actually paid for the services plus statutory interest” in a case involving an underlying criminal representation — apply where the underlying representation is a civil one?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.
